title: 2016 Uhrencup
text:
The 2016 Uhrencup was a summer <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly tournament</a>. Matches were played in <a href="Grenchen">Grenchen</a> and <a href="Biel/Bienne">Biel</a>. Swiss clubs <a href="BSC%20Young%20Boys">Young Boys</a> (<a href="Swiss%20Super%20League">Super League</a>) and <a href="FC%20Z%C3%BCrich">Zürich</a> (<a href="Swiss%20Challenge%20League">Challenge League</a>) were joined by <a href="Borussia%20M%C3%B6nchengladbach">Borussia Mönchengladbach</a> (Germany) and <a href="Galatasaray%20S.K.%20%28football%29">Galatasaray</a> (Turkey). It was the 52nd edition of the <a href="Uhrencup">Uhrencup</a>, but the first since 2013.
Overview.
Standings.
The tournament consisted of four matches, with three points given for a win, two for a penalty shoot-out win, one for a penalty shoot-out loss or a draw, and zero for a loss. A <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shoot-out</a> was used to determine the winners if tied after 90 minutes. However, after the final match between Galatasaray and Young Boys finished as a 1–1 draw, Galatasaray mathematically became champions, therefore no penalty shoot-out took place.
